      • getFragmentByPosition

        public Fragment getFragmentByPosition(int index)
        Get Fragment at index position

        This method uses a none-static means to retrieve a fragment from the PageAdaptor. Unlike other methods, such as the static makeFragmentName(int, int), it does not assume any tagging convention used internally by FragmentPagerAdapter.

        This method is the preferred way to retrieve a Fragment

        Parameters:
        index - Fragment position. See PagerAdapter.getCount() .
        Returns:
        a Fragment or null if none found

      • makeFragmentName

        public static String makeFragmentName(int viewId,
                      int index)
        Get the tag of a Fragment within the the ViewPager

        This method generates the tag of a Fragment based upon its index and container. With the tag, one can then retrieve the Fragment associated to it from the TabsPagerAdaptor. However the actual tag format is not guaranteed to be consistent with what is used by FragmentManager.

        This method should not be used for production reasons. Instead use getFragmentByPosition(int index) to retrieve a Fragment.

        Parameters:
        viewId - ViewPager ID
        index - index of the fragment
        Returns:
        a generated tag
        See Also:
        StackOverflow Article
